# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's a Julia function that meets your requirements:
```julia
function clean_column(col)
    col = lowercase(col)
    col = replace(col, r"^ *", "") # remove leading whitespaces
    col = replace(col, r" *$", "") # remove trailing whitespaces
    col = replace(col, r" ", "_") # replace spaces with underscore
    col = replace(col, r"-", "_")  # replace hyphens with underscore
    return col
end
```
This function will clean the column name as per your description.
